snippet.title: Recipe: Veal Chops with Lemon-Basil Butter
snippet.description: ... Veal Chops with Lemon-Basil Butter Serves 2 This simple dish has a light, lemony flavor that enhances the taste of the veal. 2 tablespoons butter, at room temperature 1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh basil or 1 teaspoon dried, crumbled 1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon rind 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice 2 1-inch-thick veal loin chops Preheat the broiler. Combine the butter, basil, lemon rind, and lemon juice in a small bowl. Hold each chop on its edge, fat side up. With a small, sharp knife, cut through the fat and halfway through the chop to create a small pocket. Stuff some of the butter mixture into each chop, then spread the remaining butter mixture on both sides of the chops. Place the chops on a broiler pan and broil about 4 inches from the heat, turning once, for 5 to 6 minutes per side, or until browned and tender. With a fork, pierce the chop, checking often for doneness; overcooking will toughen the veal. Serve immediately. Copyright © 2000 David R. Mar... ...

snippet.title: I had a Basile cell removed over 2 weeks ago, it was just under my left eye tear duct & next to my noise. I am still healing but it doesn't look as bad as it did a on day 10,
snippet.description: ... I still have stitches that have not disolved. After reading many of these messages I am scared to death now to have the MOHS procedure & reconstruction surgery.I didn't take the time to discuss other options with the eye surgeon. He probably doesn't want me to know the whole story so I won't back out of it. Oct 31 I have the Mohs & then reconstruction. He told me I would be out of work 1 week for the upcoming procedures. I explained to him I have short & long term disability insurance I have paid for years & didn't use it as well as weeks of Paid time off saved. He then said 2 wks I could be out. I also work in a hospital, non clinical but do see patients often. I don't want to go to work looking like a monster. The pictures also scar me. What other options are there since it is close to eye lids, & maybe involves the lids? I am already on anti depressents & anxiety meds due to a house fire & other pit falls. I am worried how this will effect me menta... ...

snippet.title: My husband is using Aldara to treat a small basil on the bottom of his eyelid. Some has slipped into his eye causing much discomfort. Is this dangerous. What should he do?

Healthy Slow-Cooked Manhattan Clam Chowder Recipe (Paleo/Primal)
snippet.description: ... The view from my window as I write this sharepost shows a dank and dismal day. I stepped outside earlier and the cold chilled me through to the bone. Yes, this is a good day to make a pot of soup. ... ... My family is really good at making soup. My mother makes great soup. My father makes great soup. My brother makes great soup. And if I do say so myself, I make great soup. I don’t know why it is but, like our brown eyes, I think it’s something in our DNA. I say this because none of us has ever discussed soup-making or shared a recipe. Yet, we rock the soup pot. Surely it must be something in our genetic make-up. ... ... Soup’s on… ... ... I developed this hearty Manhattan Clam Chowder last year for my dad’s birthday. I served it as the first course, but truly it is a soup that eats like a meal. Instead of loading the chowder with the usual potatoes, I use a variety of organic fresh-from-the-farm root vegetables courtesy of my CSA (community supporte... ...
